EU-US trade war looms as an uneven agreement takes shape
subhead: With one week left before Donald Trump's deadline for a deal, with threats to impose 30% tariffs on European imports, Brussels scrambles to avert a trade war. A partial agreement is emerging, but it remains uncertain given Trump's unpredictability.

French ski coach suspended after sexual assault complaints
subhead: The French Ski Federation, which had referred the case to its ethics committee after Le Monde's initial revelations, announced on Wednesday that it had launched a disciplinary procedure and would join the case as a plaintiff.

title: Syrian commission of inquiry releases report on mass killings in Alawite regions
subhead: The identities of 1,426 victims of the massacres committed in March have been confirmed, and a 'provisional' list of 298 suspects has been drawn up. Yet NGOs fear that the absence of any charges brought against military leaders will lead to a cycle of vengeance and impunity.

title: Jihadists are intensifying drone attacks in the Sahel
subhead: The Sahelian branch of Al-Qaeda, primarily active in Mali and Burkina Faso, has acquired the capacity to arm low-cost devices. This recent expertise has inflicted heavy losses on national armies.

title: Harry's Bar: A taste of America in Paris
subhead: A Parisian temple to the cocktail, Harry's New York Bar has continued, since its founding in 1911, to attract both Americans on the move and French patrons looking to quench their thirst for all things American. Visitors come to savor perfectly executed classics as well as elegant new creations.

title: French ski coach faces sexual assault complaint involving a minor and new accusations
subhead: Following Le Monde's initial revelations about allegations of sexual harassment of minors against Joël Chenal, a former Olympic ski silver medalist, five young women have come forward with new accounts.

title: From Mark Zuckerberg to Elon Musk, the Palo Alto 'boys' club'
subhead: 'Tech Oligarchs' (4/6). The top executives of Silicon Valley are steeped in a predominantly male 'geek culture,' one that has been marked by heated debates over the role of women for the past 20 years.
byline: Damien Leloup,  Alexandre Piquard and  Raphaëlle Bacqué
